H6: Strokes of Genius

PARAGRAPHS

A conversation about a garage full of paint tins and the difficulties with disposing of them was the catalyst for the launch of forward-thinking new company YesColours, who have tackled the problem by developing Europe’s first waste saving, fully recyclable paint pouches.

“Currently over 55 million litres of paint and 14,000 tonnes of tins go to landfill every year and only two per cent are recycled, which is astonishing,” says creative director and co-founder Emma Bestley. “Our aim is to empower customers that care about the environment, and being hugely passionate about sustainability ourselves it’s at the heart of how we operate; from supply chains to raw materials, to supporting British manufacturers. Our paint is also available by the litre to help avoid over ordering, which is a massive contributor to UK paint waste.” Formulating vegan, cruelty-free products with zero per cent added VOCs (Volatile organic compounds that give synthetic products a ‘new carpet’ smell and are sometimes harmful) was also a priority, as was avoiding the use of any microplastics.

Horizontal rule

Respondents to our Attitudes Survey also take an optimistic view, with 93% expecting their clients wealth to stay the same or increase in 2021. Just over one-fifth of these expect a significant – above 10% – increase.

Same or increase in 2021. Just over one-fifth of these expect a significant – above 10% – increase.

Ordered list

  1. Global population of UHNWIs will grow by 27% over the next five years
  2. Asia tops our five-year UHNWI growth forecast with 39%, led by Indonesia on 67% and India on 63%
  3. Africa is expected to see the second biggest regional five-year UHNWI growth rate
